posts.content:
I am presently putting my 1964 interior back together and wanted to get confirmation on what fixes the hinges and catches to the shaving mirror and other small cupboard on the upright front of the back wardrobe units. I have the small cupboards with side hinges, not the fold down ones. Mine had a combination of aluminium rivets and brass screws with raw plugs (I guess these are incorrect!!!).

So should the correct fixings be rivets?

Thanks in advance.

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
Have sent you an email dude.

Shalom, Lee.

Lee,

Many thanks for the photo's. I have searched around but cannot find any of the 4mm (5/32") original looking punch rivets.

I think so far the second best I have come up with is these black rivets http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/280907168727? ... 1438.l2649 and I will back them with 4mm aluminium washers to ensure they stay in place. I will have to nick the side off the washer to fit at the back adjacent to the cupboard.

Cheers,

Raymond
